dialogue.introduction: Good day. I am Bismarck, the nameship of the Bismarck-class battleships. You should remember it well.
dialogue.library_intro: It is I, the pride of Deutschland, the nameship of the Bismarck super dreadnoughts. Germanic designs are just beautiful and dignified, no? It's alright, you can praise me more. I shall be operating far and wide throughout this ocean. You can expect much from me!
dialogue.secretary1: Good. It is I, Bismarck's turn.
dialogue.secretary2: You're being quite familiar. Why is that? Operation Rhein√ºbung, is it? This brings back memories. (zwei)
dialogue.secretary3: Admiral, it seems that your fleet is lacking in discipline. I shall instruct you from the basics.
dialogue.secretaryidle: Geez~! To neglect one such as myself, aren't you quite something! It's fine for me to come along on a sortie or practice, you know!?
dialogue.secretarymarried: Admiral, no matter what it is, it's bad to work too hard, okay? A change of pace is also a good thing, you know?
dialogue.wedding: Admiral, what is it? Such an earnest expression... This is for me? ...I-I see... Y-you can give it to me. I won't give this back, you know? Definitely...
dialogue.show_players_score: What is it? Has the situation changed for the better?
dialogue.joining_a_fleet: Battleship Bismarck, setting sail! Sally forth!
dialogue.supply: My thanks. I can continue to fight with this.
dialogue.docking_moderate_damage: Apologies, I shall take a short respite. Please call on me later.
dialogue.ship_construction: It appears that a new ship has been commissioned.
dialogue.return_from_sortie: Operation complete, the fleet has returned to port.
dialogue.start_a_sortie: I shall show you how Bismarck fights!
dialogue.battle_start: A fleet battle... I'm itching for a fight!
dialogue.night_battle: I won't let you escape... Don't underestimate me!
dialogue.mvp: I am number one? What are you saying, of course that's the case. Is that not good? You can praise me more.
dialogue.minor_damaged1: Guh! Ahh! This reminds me of those annoying biplanes...! (zwei)
dialogue.moderately_damaged: They got me...! The rudder! Is the rudder alright!?... Well then, I can continue on...from here.
dialogue.sunk: Once again, I shall return to Brest... I exchanged enough shells... I'm...satisfied...
dialogue.christmas_2015: This year's Christmas season has already come? Wasn't that fast? Then, exchanging presents is acceptable!.
dialogue.new_year_2016: Admiral, let's work hard this year too! Naturally, I'm always working hard though!

hourly.0000: 12 o'clock midnight. I'm a little tired.
hourly.0100: 1 A.M. Admiral, is it not about time for bed?
hourly.0200: 2 A.M. *ya~wn*... Of course, I'm tired also...
hourly.0300: 3 A.M. You will rise properly tomorrow, yes? Could you please be punctual in the morning?
hourly.0400: 4 A.M. I shall take a short nap. All-nighters are bad for the skin.
hourly.0500: It's 5 A.M. Alrighty, get up! Good morning!
hourly.0600: 6 A.M. Well now, Admiral, let's go and get all the morning affairs in order!
hourly.0700: 7 A.M. Admiral, it is time for breakfast. What have you prepared for me?
hourly.0800: 8 A.M. This Admiral-made breakfast is pretty good. Japanese-style isn't bad.
hourly.0900: 9 A.M. Well now, let us up and go and start today's commerce raiding! ...Eh, I'm mistaken?
hourly.1000: 10 A.M. Kongou? Nagato? No, I don't know them. Who are they? Are they strong?
hourly.1100: It's 11 A.M... Yamato-class? That's got a strong feeling to it. I'd like to meet them.
hourly.1200: I am informing you that is it now 12 midday. Well now, what would be good for lunch?
hourly.1300: 1 P.M. Oh, those destroyers of a familiar ship class are here. I know those kids.
hourly.1400: 2 P.M. I wonder if Scharnhorst has also come here. I still would like to meet her.
hourly.1500: It's 3 P.M. I'd like to eat a little something sweet. Hey Admiral, did you hear me?
hourly.1600: 4 P.M. Almost evening, no? Shall we leave it at this?
hourly.1700: 5 P.M. Phew~, today was hard work as well. Well now, shall we stop at this checkpoint for today?
hourly.1800: 6 P.M. Almost time for dinner. Admiral, what kind of menu do you have for me?
hourly.1900: It is 7 P.M. The Admiral's sauerkraut has an odd flavor... Oh, this is 'tsukemono', you say?
hourly.2000: 8 P.M. It's really night now... It's bad for my skin, so could we not go on a night battle?
hourly.2100: 9 P.M. H~mm, Japanese battleships have such tall bridges. Those sisters sure are something.
hourly.2200: It's 10 P.M. I shall take a rest soon.
hourly.2300: 11 P.M. Admiral, are you still going? Good night.
